intro: Berkheya coddii, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and green, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. It produces small, pale yellow disk flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Berkheya coddii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal climates.
